Configure the severities available to the findings logged on models to ensure that they reflect your organization's tracking requirements.

::: {.attn}

## Prerequisites

- [x] {{< var link.login >}}
- [x] You are a [{{< fa hand >}} Customer Admin]{.bubble} or assigned another role with sufficient permissions to perform the tasks in this guide.[^1]

:::

## Add finding severities

By default, {{< var validmind.platform >}} provides three suggested finding severities â€” [high]{.bubble .smallcaps}, [medium]{.bubble .smallcaps}, and [low]{.bubble .smallcaps}.

To add additional severities:

1. In the left sidebar, click **{{< fa gear >}} Settings**.

2. Under Findings, select **Finding Severities**.

3. Click **{{< fa plus >}} Add Finding Severity**.

4. Enter a **[name]{.smallcaps}** and select a **[color]{.smallcaps}** for the severity.

5. Click **Add Severity** to create the severity.

    Once added, [reorder the severities](#reorder-finding-severities) as required.

## Edit finding severities

1. In the left sidebar, click **{{< fa gear >}} Settings**.

2. Under Findings, select **Finding Severities**.

3. Hover over the severity you would like to edit.

4. When the **{{< fa ellipsis-vertical >}}** appears, click on it and select **{{< fa pencil >}} Edit Severity**.

5. Make your changes to the **[name]{.smallcaps}** and **[color]{.smallcaps}** of the severity.

6. Click **Update Severity** to apply your edits.


## Reorder finding severities

Finding severities range from most severe at the top to least severe at the bottom.

To reorder severities:

1. In the left sidebar, click **{{< fa gear >}} Settings**.

2. Under Findings, select **Finding Severities**.

3. Click and hold to drag a severity up or down.

4. Click **Save** to apply the order.

## Remove finding severities

::: {.callout-important title="Removal of finding severities is permanent."}
Severities can only be deleted if they are not in use by any findings.

:::

1. In the left sidebar, click **{{< fa gear >}} Settings**.

2. Under Findings, select **Finding Severities**.

3. Hover over the severity you would like to delete.

4. When the **{{< fa ellipsis-vertical >}}** appears, click on it and select [**{{< fa trash-can >}} Delete Severity**]{.red}.

5. After you confirm, the severity will be removed from the list.
